page.title: 19TREES IN DISTRICT OF MARSKE.
page.content: Marske is well known for the beauty of it's trees. As part of an old estate there are unusual number of mature hardwoods, some of them specimen trees. A few elms are still alive but most have succumbed to Dutch Elms Disease. There is an avenue of old Limes & some unusual Conifers in the grounds of Marske Hall. There are plantings of Larch & small areas of mixed wood & some Natural Regeneration Elderberry, Silver Birch & Alder. These are undergrown with Blackberry Bushes, Briar & Sloe. Along with these bushes there are Hawthorn, Mountain Ash, Pussy Willow, Ash and Sycamore in the hedgerows.
